Documentation.content: Extracts the year from a date type.
Documentation.return: An integer representing the year.
Documentation.param: date The date.

Documentation.content: Extracts the month from a date type.
Documentation.return: An integer representing the year.
Documentation.param: date The date.

Documentation.content: Extracts the day of the month from a date type.
Documentation.return: An integer representing the year.
Documentation.param: date The date.

Documentation.content: Extracts the hour from a time type.
Documentation.return: An integer representing the hour.
Documentation.param: time The time.

Documentation.content: Extracts the minutes from a time type.
Documentation.return: An integer representing the minutes.
Documentation.param: time The time.

Documentation.content: Extracts the seconds from a time type.
Documentation.return: An integer representing the seconds.
Documentation.param: time The time.

Documentation.content: Combines year, month day to create a date type.
Documentation.return: A date created by combining the fields.
Documentation.param: year The year (0-9999).
month The month (1-12).
day The day (1..daysInMonth).

Documentation.content: Combines hour, minute second to create a time type.
Documentation.return: A time created by combining the fields.
Documentation.param: hour The hour (0-23).
minute The minute (0-59).
second The second (0-59).

Documentation.content: Combines date and time components to create a seconds type. The date must be represented within the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.
Documentation.return: A Seconds_t value created by combining the fields.
Documentation.param: year The year (1601-30827).
month The month (1-12).
day The day (1..daysInMonth).
hour The hour (0-23).
minute The minute (0-59).
second The second (0-59).
is_local_time TRUE if the datetime components are expressed in local time rather than UTC, FALSE if the components are expressed in UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.content: Combines year, month day to create a date type.
Documentation.return: A date created by combining the fields.
Documentation.param: year The year (0-9999).
month The month (1-12).
day The day (1..daysInMonth).

Documentation.content: Combines hour, minute second to create a time type.
Documentation.return: A time created by combining the fields.
Documentation.param: hour The hour (0-23).
minute The minute (0-59).
second The second (0-59).

Documentation.content: Converts the number of seconds since epoch to a structure containing date and time parts. The result must be representable within the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.
Documentation.return: Module with exported attributes for year, month, day, hour, minute, second, day_of_week, date and time.
Documentation.param: seconds The number of seconds since epoch.

Documentation.content: Converts the number of microseconds since epoch to the number of seconds since epoch.
Documentation.return: The number of seconds since epoch.
Documentation.param: timestamp The number of microseconds since epoch.

Documentation.content: Tests whether the year is a leap year in the Gregorian calendar.
Documentation.return: True if the year is a leap year.
Documentation.param: year The year (0-9999).

Documentation.content: Tests whether a date is a leap year in the Gregorian calendar.
Documentation.return: True if the year is a leap year.
Documentation.param: date The date.

Documentation.content: Combines year, month, day in the Gregorian calendar to create the number days since 31st December 1BC.
Documentation.return: The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)
Documentation.param: year The year (-4713..9999).
month The month (1-12). A missing value (0) is treated as 1.
day The day (1..daysInMonth). A missing value (0) is treated as 1.

Documentation.content: Converts the number days since 31st December 1BC to a date in the Gregorian calendar.
Documentation.return: Module containing Year, Month, Day in the Gregorian calendar
Documentation.param: days The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)

Documentation.content: Converts a date in the Gregorian calendar to the number days since 31st December 1BC.
Documentation.return: The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)
Documentation.param: date The date (using the Gregorian calendar)

Documentation.content: Converts the number days since 31st December 1BC to a date in the Gregorian calendar.
Documentation.return: A Date_t in the Gregorian calendar
Documentation.param: days The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)

Documentation.content: Returns a number representing the day of the year indicated by the given date. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.
Documentation.return: A number (1-366) representing the number of days since the beginning of the year.
Documentation.param: date A Date_t value.

Documentation.content: Returns a number representing the day of the week indicated by the given date. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.
Documentation.return: A number 1-7 representing the day of the week, where 1 = Sunday.
Documentation.param: date A Date_t value.

Documentation.content: Tests whether the year is a leap year in the Julian calendar.
Documentation.return: True if the year is a leap year.
Documentation.param: year The year (0-9999).

Documentation.content: Combines year, month, day in the Julian calendar to create the number days since 31st December 1BC.
Documentation.return: The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)
Documentation.param: year The year (-4800..9999).
month The month (1-12).
day The day (1..daysInMonth).

Documentation.content: Converts the number days since 31st December 1BC to a date in the Julian calendar.
Documentation.return: Module containing Year, Month, Day in the Julian calendar
Documentation.param: days The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)

Documentation.content: Converts a date in the Julian calendar to the number days since 31st December 1BC.
Documentation.return: The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)
Documentation.param: date The date (using the Julian calendar)

Documentation.content: Converts the number days since 31st December 1BC to a date in the Julian calendar.
Documentation.return: A Date_t in the Julian calendar
Documentation.param: days The number of elapsed days (1 Jan 1AD = 1)

Documentation.content: Returns the number of days since 1st January 1900 (using the Gregorian Calendar)
Documentation.return: The number of elapsed days since 1st January 1900
Documentation.param: year The year (-4713..9999).
month The month (1-12). A missing value (0) is treated as 1.
day The day (1..daysInMonth). A missing value (0) is treated as 1.

Documentation.content: Returns the number of days since 1st January 1900 (using the Gregorian Calendar)
Documentation.return: The number of elapsed days since 1st January 1900
Documentation.param: date The date

Documentation.content: Converts the number days since 1st January 1900 to a date in the Julian calendar.
Documentation.return: A Date_t in the Julian calendar
Documentation.param: days The number of elapsed days since 1st Jan 1900

Documentation.content: Calculate the number of whole years between two dates.
Documentation.return: The number of years between them.
Documentation.param: from The first date
to The last date

Documentation.content: Calculate the number of whole months between two dates.
Documentation.return: The number of months between them.
Documentation.param: from The first date
to The last date

Documentation.content: Calculate the number of days between two dates.
Documentation.return: The number of days between them.
Documentation.param: from The first date
to The last date

Documentation.content: Combines the fields from a Date_rec to create a Date_t
Documentation.return: A Date_t representing the combined values.
Documentation.param: date The row containing the date.

Documentation.content: Combines the fields from a Date_rec to create a Date_t
Documentation.return: A Date_t representing the combined values.
Documentation.param: date The row containing the date.

Documentation.content: Combines the fields from a Time_rec to create a Time_t
Documentation.return: A Time_t representing the combined values.
Documentation.param: time The row containing the time.

Documentation.content: Combines the date fields from a DateTime_rec to create a Date_t
Documentation.return: A Date_t representing the combined values.
Documentation.param: datetime The row containing the datetime.

Documentation.content: Combines the time fields from a DateTime_rec to create a Time_t
Documentation.return: A Time_t representing the combined values.
Documentation.param: datetime The row containing the datetime.

Documentation.content: Combines the date and time fields from a DateTime_rec to create a Seconds_t
Documentation.return: A Seconds_t representing the combined values.
Documentation.param: datetime The row containing the datetime.
is_local_time TRUE if the datetime components are expressed in local time rather than UTC, FALSE if the components are expressed in UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.content: Converts a string to a Date_t using the relevant string format. The resulting date must be representable within the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600.
Documentation.return: The date that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match or if the date components match but the result is an invalid date. Supported characters: %B Full month name %b or %h Abbreviated month name %d Day of month (two digits) %e Day of month (two digits, or a space followed by a single digit) %m Month (two digits) %t Whitespace %y year within century (00-99) %Y Full year (yyyy) %j Julian day (1-366) Common date formats American '%m/%d/%Y' mm/dd/yyyy Euro '%d/%m/%Y' dd/mm/yyyy Iso format '%Y-%m-%d' yyyy-mm-dd Iso basic 'Y%m%d' yyyymmdd '%d-%b-%Y' dd-mon-yyyy e.g., '21-Mar-1954'
Documentation.param: date_text The string to be converted.
format The format of the input string. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.content: Converts a string to a date using the relevant string format.
Documentation.return: The date that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match.
Documentation.param: date_text The string to be converted.
format The format of the input string. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.content: Converts a string to a Time_t using the relevant string format.
Documentation.return: The time that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match. Supported characters: %H Hour (two digits) %k (two digits, or a space followed by a single digit) %M Minute (two digits) %S Second (two digits) %t Whitespace
Documentation.param: date_text The string to be converted.
format The format of the input string. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.content: Matches a string against a set of date string formats and returns a valid Date_t object from the first format that successfully parses the string.
Documentation.return: The date that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match.
Documentation.param: date_text The string to be converted.
formats A set of formats to check against the string. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.content: Matches a string against a set of time string formats and returns a valid Time_t object from the first format that successfully parses the string.
Documentation.return: The time that was matched in the string. Returns 0 if failed to match.
Documentation.param: time_text The string to be converted.
formats A set of formats to check against the string. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.content: Formats a date as a string.
Documentation.return: Blank if date cannot be formatted, or the date in the requested format.
Documentation.param: date The date to be converted.

format The format template to use for the conversion; see strftime() for appropriate values. The maximum length of the resulting string is 255 characters. Optional; defaults to '%Y-%m-%d' which is YYYY-MM-DD.

Documentation.content: Formats a time as a string.
Documentation.return: Blank if the time cannot be formatted, or the time in the requested format.
Documentation.param: time The time to be converted.

format The format template to use for the conversion; see strftime() for appropriate values. The maximum length of the resulting string is 255 characters. Optional; defaults to '%H:%M:%S' which is HH:MM:SS.

Documentation.content: Converts a Seconds_t value into a human-readable string using a format template.
Documentation.return: The converted seconds as a string.
Documentation.param: seconds The seconds since epoch.

format The format template to use for the conversion; see strftime() for appropriate values. The maximum length of the resulting string is 255 characters. Optional; defaults to '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S' which is YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.

Documentation.content: Formats a date as a string.
Documentation.return: Blank if date cannot be formatted, or the date in the requested format.
Documentation.param: date The date to be converted.
format The format the date is output in. (See documentation for strftime)

Documentation.content: Converts a date from one format to another
Documentation.return: The converted string, or blank if it failed to match the format.
Documentation.param: date_text The string containing the date to be converted.
from_format The format the date is to be converted from.
to_format The format the date is to be converted to.

Documentation.content: Converts a date from one format to another
Documentation.return: The converted string, or blank if it failed to match the format.
Documentation.param: date_text The string containing the date to be converted.
from_format The format the date is to be converted from.
to_format The format the date is to be converted to.

Documentation.content: Converts a time from one format to another
Documentation.return: The converted string, or blank if it failed to match the format.
Documentation.param: time_text The string containing the time to be converted.
from_format The format the time is to be converted from.
to_format The format the time is to be converted to.

Documentation.content: Converts a date that matches one of a set of formats to another.
Documentation.return: The converted string, or blank if it failed to match the format.
Documentation.param: date_text The string containing the date to be converted.
from_formats The list of formats the date is to be converted from.
to_format The format the date is to be converted to.

Documentation.content: Converts a date that matches one of a set of formats to another.
Documentation.return: The converted string, or blank if it failed to match the format.
Documentation.param: date_text The string containing the date to be converted.
from_formats The list of formats the date is to be converted from.
to_format The format the date is to be converted to.

Documentation.content: Converts a time that matches one of a set of formats to another.
Documentation.return: The converted string, or blank if it failed to match the format.
Documentation.param: time_text The string containing the time to be converted.
from_formats The list of formats the time is to be converted from.
to_format The format the time is to be converted to.

Documentation.content: Adjusts a date by incrementing or decrementing year, month and/or day values. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600. If the new calculated date is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules. Example: 20140130 + 1 month = 20140302.
Documentation.return: The adjusted Date_t value.
Documentation.param: date The date to adjust.
year_delta The requested change to the year value; optional, defaults to zero.
month_delta The requested change to the month value; optional, defaults to zero.
day_delta The requested change to the day of month value; optional, defaults to zero.

Documentation.content: Adjusts a date by adding or subtracting seconds. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600. If the new calculated date is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules. Example: 20140130 + 172800 seconds = 20140201.
Documentation.return: The adjusted Date_t value.
Documentation.param: date The date to adjust.
seconds_delta The requested change to the date, in seconds.

Documentation.content: Adjusts a time by incrementing or decrementing hour, minute and/or second values. If the new calculated time is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules.
Documentation.return: The adjusted Time_t value.
Documentation.param: time The time to adjust.
hour_delta The requested change to the hour value; optional, defaults to zero.
minute_delta The requested change to the minute value; optional, defaults to zero.
second_delta The requested change to the second of month value; optional, defaults to zero.

Documentation.content: Adjusts a time by adding or subtracting seconds. If the new calculated time is invalid then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules.
Documentation.return: The adjusted Time_t value.
Documentation.param: time The time to adjust.
seconds_delta The requested change to the time, in seconds.

Documentation.content: Adjusts a Seconds_t value by adding or subtracting years, months, days, hours, minutes and/or seconds. This is performed by first converting the seconds into a full date/time structure, applying any delta values to individual date/time components, then converting the structure back to the number of seconds. This interim date must lie within Gregorian calendar after the year 1600. If the interim structure is found to have an invalid date/time then it will be normalized according to mktime() rules. Therefore, some delta values (such as "1 month") are actually relative to the value of the seconds argument.
Documentation.return: The adjusted Seconds_t value.
Documentation.param: seconds The number of seconds to adjust.
year_delta The requested change to the year value; optional, defaults to zero.
month_delta The requested change to the month value; optional, defaults to zero.
day_delta The requested change to the day of month value; optional, defaults to zero.
hour_delta The requested change to the hour value; optional, defaults to zero.
minute_delta The requested change to the minute value; optional, defaults to zero.
second_delta The requested change to the second of month value; optional, defaults to zero.

Documentation.content: Adjusts a date by incrementing or decrementing months and/or years. This routine uses the rule outlined in McGinn v. State, 46 Neb. 427, 65 N.W. 46 (1895): "The term calendar month, whether employed in statutes or contracts, and not appearing to have been used in a different sense, denotes a period terminating with the day of the succeeding month numerically corresponding to the day of its beginning, less one. If there be no corresponding day of the succeeding month, it terminates with the last day thereof." The internet suggests similar legal positions exist in the Commonwealth and Germany. Note that day adjustments are performed after year and month adjustments using the preceding rules. As an example, Jan. 31, 2014 + 1 month will result in Feb. 28, 2014; Jan. 31, 2014 + 1 month + 1 day will result in Mar. 1, 2014.
Documentation.return: The adjusted Date_t value.
Documentation.param: date The date to adjust, in the Gregorian calendar after 1600.
year_delta The requested change to the year value; optional, defaults to zero.
month_delta The requested change to the month value; optional, defaults to zero.
day_delta The requested change to the day value; optional, defaults to zero.

Documentation.return: TRUE if daylight savings time is currently in effect, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.content: Returns a boolean indicating whether daylight savings time is currently in effect locally.

Documentation.return: The number of seconds offset from UTC.
Documentation.content: Returns the offset (in seconds) of the time represented from UTC, with positive values indicating locations east of the Prime Meridian. Given a UTC time in seconds since epoch, you can find the local time by adding the result of this function to the seconds.
Returns the current date.
Documentation.return: A Date_t representing the current date.
Documentation.param: in_local_time TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the date, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.return: A Date_t representing the current date.
Documentation.content: Returns the current date in the local time zone.
Returns the current time of day
Documentation.return: A Time_t representing the current time of day.
Documentation.param: in_local_time TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the time, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.content: Returns the current date and time as the number of seconds since epoch.
Documentation.return: A Seconds_t representing the current time in UTC or local time, depending on the argument.
Documentation.param: in_local_time TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the time, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.content: Returns the current date and time as the number of microseconds since epoch.
Documentation.return: A Timestamp_t representing the current time in microseconds in UTC or local time, depending on the argument.
Documentation.param: in_local_time TRUE if the returned value should be local to the cluster computing the time, FALSE for UTC. Optional, defaults to FALSE.

Documentation.content: Returns the beginning and ending dates for the month surrounding the given date.
Documentation.return: Module with exported attributes for startDate and endDate.
Documentation.param: as_of_date The reference date from which the month will be calculated. This date must be a date within the Gregorian calendar. Optional, defaults to the current date in UTC.

Documentation.content: Returns the beginning and ending dates for the week surrounding the given date (Sunday marks the beginning of a week).
Documentation.return: Module with exported attributes for startDate and endDate.
Documentation.param: as_of_date The reference date from which the week will be calculated. This date must be a date within the Gregorian calendar. Optional, defaults to the current date in UTC.

Documentation.content: Tests whether a date is valid, both by range-checking the year and by validating each of the other individual components.
Documentation.return: TRUE if the date is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.param: date The date to validate.
yearLowerBound The minimum acceptable year. Optional; defaults to 1800.
yearUpperBound The maximum acceptable year. Optional; defaults to 2100.

Documentation.content: Tests whether a date is valid in the Gregorian calendar. The year must be between 1601 and 30827.
Documentation.return: TRUE if the date is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.param: date The Date_t to validate.

Documentation.content: Tests whether a time is valid.
Documentation.return: TRUE if the time is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Documentation.param: time The time to validate.

Documentation.content: A transform to create a Date_rec from the individual elements
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Date_rec containing the date.
Documentation.param: year The year
month The month (1-12).
day The day (1..daysInMonth).

Documentation.content: A transform to create a Date_rec from a Seconds_t value.
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Date_rec containing the date.
Documentation.param: seconds The number seconds since epoch.

Documentation.content: A transform to create a Time_rec from the individual elements
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Time_rec containing the time of day.
Documentation.param: hour The hour (0-23).
minute The minute (0-59).
second The second (0-59).

Documentation.content: A transform to create a Time_rec from a Seconds_t value.
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a Time_rec containing the time of day.
Documentation.param: seconds The number seconds since epoch.

Documentation.content: A transform to create a DateTime_rec from the individual elements
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a DateTime_rec containing date and time components.
Documentation.param: year The year
month The month (1-12).
day The day (1..daysInMonth).
hour The hour (0-23).
minute The minute (0-59).
second The second (0-59).

Documentation.content: A transform to create a DateTime_rec from a Seconds_t value.
Documentation.return: A transform that creates a DateTime_rec containing date and time components.
Documentation.param: seconds The number seconds since epoch.
